meanings.definition: To impose or place before something else.
meanings.sent1: I will preimpose the dessert on the table before the main course.
meanings.sent2: The teacher will preimpose the homework assignment at the beginning of the class.
meanings.sent3: He decided to preimpose his favorite song as the alarm tone to wake up with a smile.
meanings.sent4: The artist chose to preimpose a splash of red in the corner to draw attention to the painting.
meanings.sent5: She always preimposes her signature at the bottom of the letter to add a personal touch.

meanings.definition: To require or demand in advance.
meanings.sent1: The hotel will preimpose a deposit for the reservation.
meanings.sent2: The company may preimpose a background check before hiring new employees.
meanings.sent3: The magician jokingly preimposed a round of applause before his magic trick.
meanings.sent4: The coach preimposed a strict training regimen on the team to prepare for the championship.
meanings.sent5: The landlord preimposed a rule of no pets in the apartment complex to avoid any issues.
